arm_group.description:
Study participants (healthy) are treated with auricular vagus nerve stimulation using five needle electrodes connected to an electrical stimulation device (PrimeStim). After acclimatization the stimulation is turned on for 20 minutes followed by 20 minutes of paused stimulation, 20 minutes of stimulation, and 10 minutes paused stimulation. This intervention is repeated on four consecutive days, whereas at each intervention only one of the four stimulation points (and one fixed reference point) is stimulated. Needle electrodes are applied at each study visit.
Stimulation points in the auricle are stimulated in random order. One stimulation pattern is tested. Stimulation amplitudes are adjusted with respect to a distinct but comfortable sensation at the auricle.
During the described protocol various biosignals are continuously recorded, including ECG, respiration, blood perfusion, oxygen saturation, transcutaneous oxygen tension, blood pressure and skin temperature.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this pilot study is to evaluate the effect of auricular autonomous nervous
      system stimulation on cardiovascular parameters and sympathovagal balance in healthy
      subjects. It is investigated if auricular vagal nerve stimulation affects heart rate
      variability as well as peripheral local blood perfusion, and if this effect depends on the
      site of stimulation in the auricle, whereas four distinct stimulation points are tested.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study - Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation Effects on Cardiovascular Parameters
clinical_study.condition: Modulation of Cardiovascular Parameters and Sympathovagal Balance in Healthy Subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  men and women aged 20 to 50 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  participation in a clinical trial in the last 5 weeks

          -  diseases which may affect the autonomous nervous system (e.g., diabetes mellitus)

          -  confounding medical treatment with known effects on the autonomous nervous system
             (e.g., beta blocker)

          -  drug abuse

          -  active implanted devices

          -  pregnancy or nursing

clinical_study.keyword: vagus nerve stimulation effects on heart rate variability and peripheral blood perfusion

facility.name: University Clinic for Surgery, Department of Transplantation, Medical University Vienna

clinical_study.official_title: Functional Mapping of Auricular Vagal Stimulation Points on Cardiovascular Parameters in Healthy Subjects - Pilot Study

overall_official.affiliation: University Clinic for Surgery, Department of Transplantation, Medical University Vienna

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Agency for Health and Food Safety

primary_outcome.description:
Heart rate variability will be assessed as, e.g., standard deviation in heart rate over a time window of 5 minutes (2.5 minutes overlap), total power or low to high frequency power.
Changes in assessed heart rate variability parameters will be assessed and compared between subjects with respect to stimulation site using statistical tests.
primary_outcome.measure: change in heart rate variability (HRV) related to stimulation site in the auricle
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

primary_outcome.description:
Blood perfusion index at the foot will be assessed as peak-peak amplitude (systolic to diastolic) divided by the mean signal value of optically measured blood perfusion.
Changes in mean value and standard deviation of local blood perfusion index will be assessed and compared between subjects with respect to stimulation site using statistical tests.
primary_outcome.measure: change in local blood perfusion index (BPI) related to stimulation site in the auricle
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Local BPI is assessed using optical sensors on the foot and the finger of participants.
Changes in mean value of BPI are analyzed using statistical tests.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change of local BPI in upper and lower extremities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is continuously measured using inflatable finger cuffs.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory activity is monitored using a respiratory belt.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in oxygen saturation of the toe
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in partial transcutaneous oxygen pressure of the forefoot
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles
within 4 days of intervention, at each day of intervention from baseline to stimulation and pause cycles

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of C reactive protein- and leukocyte-concentration in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at screening and at the last day of intervention

secondary_outcome.description: Tolerance of stimulation is assessed by free survey.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at each day of intervention at the stimulation cycles

secondary_outcome.description: Perception of stimulation is assessed by free survey.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at each day of intervention at the stiumulation cycles
